ygData.messageBody:
According to Tony B:
> that is the reason i always tell wizards im grouped with to just be patient
> and save their spells until the creature is past 50% damaged. i guess if

I usually don't wait. I simply tally up the damage done by my friend, and
fire up a new spell when he has done about 15% below what I did. The proximity
effect (the MOB takes distance into account) keep it focused in the tank.
I've tested it many times: If I keep distance, the MOB pounds on my monk
friend. If I move in range, it switches immediately to me.

(other factors enter in account, like how many hits he still have. If he goes
near the dangerous - 2 bubble - area, I just stop taking it easy and NUKE,
NUKE, NUKE. If the mob switches to me, I'll lose lots of life, but he'll
finish it without dying)
